author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In cables and carriers there doth war wage,
O'er th'wireless realm, fierce battles of our age;
God grant us speed in warring for connection,
In life of boundless streams, divine direction.

When yon supply chains face their trials weary,
CFOs in constant prayer, e'en when teary;
The plagues be done, but still they grasp their fears,
And work the vineyard, tending through the years.

Haste, friends of Bed and Bath, & Beyond no less,
With paper bounty, seek thy store's address;
Thine coupons old, in nervous hands they rest,
To trade for goods, and know ye shall be bless'd.

feedItems.title: Cable Companies and Mobile Carriers Battle Over Fixed Wireless Internet
feedItems.content: Comcast and Charter Communications have lost customers to their less-expensive rival plans. But they insist customers will return to broadband.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Comcast and Charter Communications have lost customers to their less-expensive rival plans. But they insist customers will return to broadband.

feedItems.title: Supply Chains Remain a Priority for CFOs, Even as Pandemic Disruptions Fade
feedItems.content: As if finance chiefs didn’t have enough on their plates before the pandemic, surging shipping costs, freight logjams and factory disruptions in China over the past few years have laid bare their need to adapt and step up their involvement in boosting supply-chain resilience.
feedItems.contentSnippet: As if finance chiefs didn’t have enough on their plates before the pandemic, surging shipping costs, freight logjams and factory disruptions in China over the past few years have laid bare their need to adapt and step up their involvement in boosting supply-chain resilience.

feedItems.title: Bed Bath & Beyond Shoppers Hurry to Use Their Stacks of Coupons for the Last Time
feedItems.content: The home-goods retailer said it will stop accepting coupons on Wednesday as it winds down operations.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The home-goods retailer said it will stop accepting coupons on Wednesday as it winds down operations.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In cyber realm, a wicked strike,
Halt'ed logistics wings to spike,
A snail's somber pace unfurled,
Nature's calm disrupt'ed world.

Truck driv'rs oft burdened like the goat,
Carrying data they sadly tote,
Rabbits dash, the change foreseen,
Light'ning sweep 'cross laden green.

In lands of DeSantis and his pride,
Disney's contracts nullified,
Loyal dogs they've been befell,
Smooth'ed path mixed, tangled spell.

feedItems.title: A Cyberattack Forced a Logistics Company to Temporarily Halt Operations
feedItems.content: The Expeditors International breach shut down most of its operations for three weeks in early 2022, adding to pandemic-related snarls.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The Expeditors International breach shut down most of its operations for three weeks in early 2022, adding to pandemic-related snarls.

feedItems.title: Truck Drivers Bear Big Burden on Data Collection. Some Companies Want to Change That.
feedItems.content: Estes Express Lines is looking to automate more data collection and streamline data sharing to reduce the burden on truckers and dockworkers to track goods.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Estes Express Lines is looking to automate more data collection and streamline data sharing to reduce the burden on truckers and dockworkers to track goods.

feedItems.title: DeSantis's Disney Board to Consider Nullifying Contracts
feedItems.content: The company struck accords in February retaining much of its control over land near Orlando that houses its theme parks.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The company struck accords in February retaining much of its control over land near Orlando that houses its theme parks.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of nature's gaseous boon, I speak,
In whispering winds, its value creak,
For fickle fate hath turned her wheel,
And forced the noble gas to kneel.

When First Republic vested shares,
Fair fortune's face with frowns now wears,
Such pressure weighs upon their back,
A drowning ship midst sea's attack.

Oh valiant Knights of Finance, hear,
My mellow voice thy Market near,
Round up thy services and talk,
For wisdom's path is long to walk.

feedItems.title: Natural Gas Falls Sharply
feedItems.content: Natural gas’s front-month contract for May delivery that expires today fell after recent gains as investors remained bearish due to a larger overhang of supply. The more-active June delivery contract also fell.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Natural gas’s front-month contract for May delivery that expires today fell after recent gains as investors remained bearish due to a larger overhang of supply. The more-active June delivery contract also fell.

feedItems.title: First Republic Shares Under Further Pressure
feedItems.content: Shares of beleaguered regional bank First Republic were set for another steep slide after losing roughly half their value on Tuesday.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Shares of beleaguered regional bank First Republic were set for another steep slide after losing roughly half their value on Tuesday.

feedItems.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
feedItems.content: Worldline, Stantandard Chartered and more featured in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Worldline, Stantandard Chartered and more featured in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the First Republic's troubled shore,
Their shares dost face a tempest's vengeful roar,
As fortunes ebb and flow like Ocean's tide,
Their golden fleet adrift, they can't abide.

In Carlson's halls, an ember's wrath did sear,
His vulgar missives brought to light, now clear,
By Loki's tongue, these insults found their fate,
Such whispers fell, dark-woven threads of hate.

Young Biden sails through whirlwinds of despair,
An economy improved, yet storms still blare,
Steel in his grasp, the hero weathers strife,
He forges on, through troubled seas of life.

feedItems.title: First Republic Shares Under Further Pressure
feedItems.content: Shares of beleaguered regional bank First Republic are set for another steep slide after sinking nearly 50% yesterday.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Shares of beleaguered regional bank First Republic are set for another steep slide after sinking nearly 50% yesterday.

feedItems.title: Carlson's Vulgar Messages About Colleagues Helped Seal His Fate
feedItems.content: Fox News prime-time host Tucker Carlson called a senior executive the c-word in a redacted missive, and the network grew wary of further possible embarrassment.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Fox News prime-time host Tucker Carlson called a senior executive the c-word in a redacted missive, and the network grew wary of further possible embarrassment.

feedItems.title: Biden Runs On An Improved, but Still Troubled Economy
feedItems.content: The president can focus on gains, but voters see problems ahead.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The president can focus on gains, but voters see problems ahead.
